comment: She's the reason I created an account on this website to warn students to not take her class if they want to keep their sanity. She acts and grades as if you are majoring in English even tho is just a core class. there's no fdback so you don't rlly know how ur doing cuz most of her assignments are ungraded. She's the worst professor I've ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment:
Dr. Richards is an amazing teacher. She is a though grader, but only because she explains assignment guidelines down to the last detail. 
Reading in this class matters. If you watch the films, and read your textbook, you will do fine. You definitely do NOT want to drop the ball in this class.
This class was challenging, yet insightful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Her syllabus was a whole book; filled with words that made you even more confused! She assigned a discussion post every week with 4 responses and her quizzes were a mix of the textbook and films. I maybe did well on 2 or 3 of them. You have a Writing Portfolio at the end which is basically a 40 pager paper! If you can DONT TAKE HER!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: There is a lot of writing and assignments. Professor Richards grades pretty harshly and there is a lot of work but everything is explained really clearly on the syllabus so you know what you're getting into.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment:
Read the syllabus and you're good. She very clearly in detail states everything she wants from the course and the assignments that are due each week. Her assignments readily prepare you for quizzes and kind of force you to learn the material. Gives encouraging feedback.
As long as you put effort into this class, you'll receive at least a B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Mrs. Richards was very kind. She is very understanding & flexible with an online learner. The amount of readings and viewing for this class is a lot. As well, She requires several "ungraded" assignments and that I don't like. All in all I received a B. As long as you keep up with your discussion posts you really are OK. Quizzes are curved.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor has you do a lot. You will read many stories, poems, movies, and articles. You will take quizzes on how to take quizzes in her class, and if you don't your assignments will be a zero she won't change it. She is a heavy grader. You will do a lot of writing with a big writing portfolio for the final. Do not take if you have 3+ classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Richards gave minimal feedback on assignments and discussions. She would say the class wasnt working hard enough which made assignments difficult since she wanted it a certain way but wouldnt say how. Whenever someone would ask about the projects in class, she would just tell us to look at the syllabus that had no information.

Prof Richards is very specific about what she wants but everything is clearly spelled out so there's no surprises. To get a good grade you have to be all in from the first day. She answers emails quickly and is really nice. lots of reading and videos but overall a good teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: if you can take anything else any other semester, do it. She is the absolute worst, a discussion post every week, post on Tuesday or Wednesday, 4 replies to peers the next day, replies to those replies the day after. Its not at all a do it at your own pace unless you want late points. Worst teacher ever and doesnt grade everything until the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lots of homework

comment: Extremely disappointed with her as a professor. She is unwilling to assist students, refuses to grade or give feedback in accessible ways, is extremely hard to understand but also a harsh grader, and seems to care little about whether or not her students actually pass. She seems uninterested in students as people or learners. I would give her a 0.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Worst professor I have ever had. Her class is so unorganized and the assignment instructions are as clear as mad. Tough grader. Way too much homework. I had more work in this class than my other four classes combined. This was my lowest grade. The quizzes are impossible and the papers are busy work. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: This was a decent class. There was a lot of reading material and difficult tests asked for specific details about the reading. There are weekly writing assignments and at the end you have to put all of your writing together in a portfolio for your final grade. It is possible to get an A in this class but it takes a lot of effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Took this as a 4 week summer course and it was a lot more than my other courses. If you have a job and are taking more than one summer class, its probably be best if you took a different English. Its a very demanding course and most of my class is behind so... Shes a good and straightforward teacher, though! If you have the time, I recommend her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: The syllabus was straight forward, and all my questions were answered in a timely and thoughtful way. After reading some negative reviews, of which are insubstantial, I am extremely glad I took the risk and took the class. She is my favorite professor.
rating_tags: Caring--Inspirational--Gives good feedback

comment: The class itself was great and stayed interesting throughout the semester. Yes, there are weekly discussions. However, the workload is not oversaturated which gives you the opportunity to put great effort into the few assignments you're given. I highly recommend Ms. Richards Introduction to Religion class as it's my favorite I have taken thus far.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is very understanding and grades based on effort. If you do the assignment the way she asked, youll pass for sure!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: I found myself having a tough start to my semester. Dr. Richards was readily available and made sure to provide feedback for our large projects so that I could do the best possible in the course. I ended with an A, a small miracle, but feel that I am leaving the course having learned a lot and a much better student and person!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I had Mrs. Anne as a last minute substitute professor for my Intro to Religion class. She was very helpful and brought the class to a successful, stress-free, and thought-provoking end. She worked with students to make sure we were given the appropriate material in order to complete the class, and she made herself very accessible. 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: When taking Professor Richards class you have to be ready to stay on your A game when it comes to reading up on every chapters weekly material, as well be very careful on how you word your papers cause she is focused on Grammer, but she does CURVE quiz grades and is understanding if your struggle, a hard professor but a fair one. QUIZZES BIWEEKLY
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Anne picked up our RELS 1102 class with a little over a month of the semester left. She was super helpful to the whole class and answered all of the questions we had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Possibly the worst professor I have ever had. Do NOT take her for online! The syllabus and course schedule often conflicted with other schedules she had posted and they never made any sense. There are tons of books to read and they are boring. There are weekly quizzes over very nitpicky details of the book. Extremely difficult class. Please beware.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: You have a book to read and videos to watch, you have to find an article, write a post on it, respond to two other people's posts, and respond to anyone that responded to yours every other week. You get no feedback on these posts so you won't know how you are doing throughout the course. You're also quizzed over obscure details of the morbid books.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She is completely scattered and inconsistent. She rarely responded to emails or questions that students had. The books you read make no sense and you learn nothing from them. The way she does online tests are like nothing I have ever seen. What a wild class.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Richards has the worst grading style I have ever encountered as a senior at KSU. She also had the worst expectations for the class. She's one of those professors who thinks her class takes priority just from the amount of workload she gives to her students. Also, her quizzes on the readings are only on sundays and only open for 30 minutes???
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Don't ever taker her. She is the most nit-picky and meticulous grader. She has outrageous demands, impossible expectations, the most unclear syllabus I have ever seen, horrible grading rubrics, everything. Worst class I've taken, and it was online. Save yourself the stress. Richards' class gave me the worst anxiety of my life.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Richards is a great professor. She really cares about her students. Midway through the semester my class had a bunch of issues and she completely changed the way the course was organized to better suit our needs - which a lot of professors wouldn't do. The assignments aren't difficult, but require meaningful thought. Make sure you read!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Didnt even know what to do for the online class. Shed simply say look at the syllabus, which didnt have everything I needed to know. Worst class Ive ever taken.. the entire class nearly got together to go to the department chair it was so unorganized. Quiz every Saturday morning at 9. Dont take this class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easiest class I've ever taken. She does make you write a lot, but it's a writing class so what do you expect. Very kind, and laid back professor who moved deadlines due to confusion. She wasn't the clearest with all her instructions though, but no final, no tests, just a lot of focus on how to professionally format your writing in the workplace.

Dr. Richards is probably the most helpful, insightful and friendliest teacher I have ever had.  She is extremely dedicated to teaching and is always available if you need help.  I would strongly recommend her to anyone!  Oh, and she prefers to be called by her first name, Anne, too.

"A little disorganized" is an understatement. I don't understand how someone could teach an online technical writing class and not have their course layout clear and easily accessible. And who in their right mind gives a final exam on a Sunday morning at seven o'clock? How rude! Being "nice" or "understanding" is not enough to be a decent teacher.
Assigns a lot of weekly group work. Does very little teaching. A little disorganized, but overall nice person.

She was by far the best professor I have had at KSU. She is very enthuiastic about the course material and knowledgeable as well. She will go out of her way to help you. I highly recommend taking any of her classes!
She is the best professor I have had thus far.  The is compassionate, which is rare thing to find in a professor nowadays.  Thought I would hate the class, but enjoyed it overall

I went with her on a study abroad trip and she made it absolutely amazing! Her classes were very creative and she was very understanding. It's too bad she is teaching in Tunisia next year, but I am so happy for her!

Very dear person. Very sweet. She is very knowledgeable. She is a little unorganized, but tries really hard. You learn a lot in her classes. If you do a good job, you are rewarded with a good grade. I would definitely take her classes again.

One of the best English teachers I've ever had! The only way u'd fail this class is if u don't show up for class & not participate in ur group work. She'll work with u in every humanly possible way just to make sure u understand the concepts. Gives u another chance to re-write ur mideterm. Highly recommended, u can never go wrong with Dr. Richards!

She was so nice and understanding. She will work with you on your papers and the subjects for her papers are interesting. She gives you free reign on most subject topics with s few guide lines. She is awesome!
Very flexible and works with students to make sure that everyone is on the same page. Very interesting, fun assignments. Class discussions are awesome. Enjoyed her class very much.

I LOVE HER SHE IS SOOO COOL AND SWEET.the class is hard if u have difficulty w/ Technical stuff otherwise she'll help you w/ EVERYTHING,and hopefully ur group as well(a LOT of GRP Work). Lots of deadlines,but gives extensions.Fair grader.Class books are interesting. No tests just projects,a lot of FUN stuff Too! HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE!Exotic Eyes :)

Dr. Richards is incredible.  She is vey nice, understanding, caring, helpful, and embodies all the characteristics a good professor should. She made the course enjoyable and really listens to students and their opinions. Paper topics are also interesting (promise)and she grades well. Loved her!
Great teacher!  Very clear, very nice, and a great class.  Great discussions, very lenient, and very helpful and understanding.
Very helpful, and nice.  Took her class not liking English, had many horrible teachers in the past, learned to love it.  Easy on the eyes too!
